qas.question: What is the approach to Judiasm that subscribes to a tradition of mass revelation?
What is the name of the book that has the laws and ethics for Orthodox Judaism?
what texts were legislated by the Tanarim and Amoraim?
What besides Modern Orthodox Judaism does Orthodox Judaism consist of?
Orthodox Judaism is a self-identification that distinguishes it from what?
What is Orthodox Christianity a religion that subscribes to?

plausible_answers.text: interpretation and application of the laws and ethics

qas.question: What does Orthodox Christianity adhere to?
Who is the Bible legislated by?
Where will you not find Modern Judaism?
What is a religion with a single philosophy?

context: <a0_0>Orthodox<a0_0/> Judaism is the approach to religious Judaism which subscribes to <b5_0>a tradition of mass revelation<b5_0/> and adheres to the <b6_0>interpretation and application of the laws and ethics<b6_0/> of the <a1_0>Torah<a1_0/> as legislated in the <a2_0>Talmudic<a2_0/> texts by <b7_0>the Tanaim and Amoraim<b7_0/>. These texts were subsequently developed and applied by later authorities, known as the Gaonim, Rishonim, and Acharonim. <b8_0>Orthodox Judaism<b8_0/> generally includes Modern Orthodox Judaism (אורתודוקסיה מודרנית) and Ultra-Orthodox or <a3_0>Haredi Judaism<a3_0/> (יהדות חרדית), but complete within is a wide range of philosophies. Although Orthodox Judaism would probably be considered the mainstream expression of <b9_0>Judaism<b9_0/> prior to the 19th century, for some Orthodox Judaism is a modern self-identification that distinguishes it from traditional <a4_0>pre-modern Judaism<a4_0/>.
